title: In order for content to be considered 'long-form content,' how long does it have to be? - Quora

response.answer_text: At least 2,500 words. Most opinion pieces are between 800–1,200 words. On the odd occasion, you will find pieces between 1,500–2,000 words. We can consider these essays, but not long-form articles. However, a long-form article is also an essay. In other words, not all essays are long-form. But if you’ve been commissioned to write a long-form article, 2,500 is the bare, bare minimum. It’s not about targeting a word count or length. Long-form pieces exact a critical look at their subject; it’s the expansive treatment of a subject that really sets long-form apart.

I believe it to be mostly about how many words have been written. I’d consider long-form content anything that is over 2000 words with a proper and defined outline and headings. Don’t just write a big 2000 words paragraph but try and section it into multiple digestible pieces with engaging headings along the way. It helps with SEO, with readability and consumption.
